intro: Commelina stolzii, commonly known as the Stolz's spiderwort, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Commelinaceae family, which includes many species with showy, often blue or white flowers. The plant typically features upright stems with lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. Its flowers are usually short-lived, opening in the morning and closing by midday. Commelina stolzii is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or along stream banks.
